intro: Centropogon lehmannii var. asservatus, commonly known as the Lehmann's centropogon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
